Source code for comet.agent.core.dialogue_policy.reinforcement_learning.net.net

import torch.nn as nn
import torch
import torch.nn.functional as F
from torch.autograd import Variable
from .layers import NoisyLinear
import math
import numpy as np
from torch.distributions import Categorical

USE_CUDA = torch.cuda.is_available()

_device = torch.device("cuda:0" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")



[docs]class DQNNetwork(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, state_size, action_size, fc1_units=64, fc2_units=64, device=_device):
        """
        Initialize parameters and build model.

        Args:
            state_size (int): Dimension of each state
            action_size (int): Dimension of each action
            fc1_units (int): Number of nodes in first hidden layer
            fc2_units (int): Number of nodes in second hidden layer
            device:
        """
        super(DQNNetwork, self).__init__()
        self.device = device
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(state_size, fc1_units)
        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(fc1_units, fc2_units)
        self.fc3 = nn.Linear(fc2_units, action_size)


[docs]    def forward(self, state):
        """Build a network that maps state -> action values."""
        x = self._format(state)
        x = F.relu(self.fc1(x))
        x = F.relu(self.fc2(x))
        x = self.fc3(x)
        return x


    def _format(self, state):
        x = state
        if not isinstance(x, torch.Tensor):
            x = torch.tensor(x, dtype=torch.float32).to(self.device)
        else:
            x = x.to(self.device)
        return x




[docs]class DQN_LSTM(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, state_size, action_size, hidden_size=100):
        super().__init__()
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(state_size, hidden_size)
        #        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(hidden_size,hidden_size)
        #        self.lstm = nn.LSTMCell(hidden_size, hidden_size)
        self.lstm = nn.LSTM(hidden_size, hidden_size, 1, batch_first=True)
        self.fc3 = nn.Linear(hidden_size, action_size)


[docs]    def forward(self, x, hx, cx):
        #        x = x.view(1,1,-1)
        #        hx = hx.view(1,1,-1)
        #        cx = cx.view(1,1,-1)

        x = F.leaky_relu(self.fc1(x))
        #        x = F.leaky_relu(self.fc2(x))
        #        hx, cx = self.lstm(x, (hx, cx))
        out, (hx, cx) = self.lstm(x, (hx, cx))
        #        hx = hx.view(hx.size(0),1,-1)
        #        cx = cx.view(cx.size(0),1,-1)

        x = F.leaky_relu(self.fc3(out))

        return x, hx, cx



[docs]    def parameter_update(self, source):
        self.load_state_dict(source.state_dict())




[docs]class CnnDQN(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, inputs_shape, num_actions):
        super(CnnDQN, self).__init__()

        self.inut_shape = inputs_shape
        self.num_actions = num_actions

        self.features = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Conv2d(inputs_shape[0], 32, kernel_size=8, stride=4),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Conv2d(32, 64, kernel_size=4, stride=2),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Conv2d(64, 64, kernel_size=3, stride=1),
            nn.ReLU()
        )

        self.fc = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(self.features_size(), 512),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(512, self.num_actions)
        )


[docs]    def forward(self, x):
        x = self.features(x)
        x = x.view(x.size(0), -1)
        x = self.fc(x)
        return x



[docs]    def features_size(self):
        return self.features(torch.zeros(1, *self.inut_shape)).view(1, -1).size(1)




[docs]class DuelingDQN(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, state_size, action_size, hidden_size=512):
        super().__init__()
        self.state_space = state_size
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(self.state_space, hidden_size)
        self.action_space = action_size
        self.fc_h = nn.Linear(hidden_size, hidden_size)
        self.fc_z_v = nn.Linear(hidden_size, 1)
        self.fc_z_a = nn.Linear(hidden_size, self.action_space)


[docs]    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.leaky_relu(self.fc1(x))
        x = F.leaky_relu(self.fc_h(x))
        v, a = self.fc_z_v(x), self.fc_z_a(x)  # Calculate value and advantage streams
        a_mean = torch.stack(a.chunk(self.action_space, 1), 1).mean(1)
        x = v.repeat(1, self.action_space) + a - a_mean.repeat(1, self.action_space)
        return x




[docs]class NoisyDQN(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, state_size, action_size):
        super(NoisyDQN, self).__init__()

        self.linear = nn.Linear(state_size, 128)
        self.noisy1 = NoisyLinear(128, 128)
        self.noisy2 = NoisyLinear(128, action_size)


[docs]    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(self.linear(x))
        x = F.relu(self.noisy1(x))
        x = self.noisy2(x)
        return x



[docs]    def act(self, state):
        state = Variable(torch.FloatTensor(state).unsqueeze(0), volatile=True)
        q_value = self.forward(state)
        return np.argmax(q_value.cpu().data.numpy())



[docs]    def reset_noise(self):
        self.noisy1.reset_noise()
        self.noisy2.reset_noise()




[docs]class CategoricalDQN(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, num_inputs, num_actions, **kwargs):
        super(CategoricalDQN, self).__init__()

        self.num_inputs = num_inputs
        self.num_actions = num_actions
        self.num_atoms = kwargs.get('num_atoms', 51)
        self.v_min = kwargs.get('v_min', -10)
        self.v_max = kwargs.get('v_max', 10)

        self.linear1 = nn.Linear(num_inputs, 128)
        self.linear2 = nn.Linear(128, 128)
        self.noisy1 = NoisyLinear(128, 512)
        self.noisy2 = NoisyLinear(512, self.num_actions * self.num_atoms)


[docs]    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(self.linear1(x))
        x = F.relu(self.linear2(x))
        x = F.relu(self.noisy1(x))
        x = self.noisy2(x)
        x = F.softmax(x.view(-1, self.num_atoms)).view(-1, self.num_actions, self.num_atoms)
        return x



[docs]    def reset_noise(self):
        self.noisy1.reset_noise()
        self.noisy2.reset_noise()



[docs]    def act(self, state):
        state = Variable(torch.FloatTensor(state).unsqueeze(0), volatile=True)
        dist = self.forward(state).data.cpu()
        dist = dist * torch.linspace(self.v_min, self.v_max, self.num_atoms)
        action = dist.sum(2).max(1)[1].numpy()[0]
        return action




[docs]class RainbowDQN(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, num_inputs, num_actions, **kwargs):
        super(RainbowDQN, self).__init__()

        self.num_inputs = num_inputs
        self.num_actions = num_actions
        self.num_atoms = kwargs.get('num_atoms', 51)
        self.v_min = kwargs.get('v_min', -10)
        self.v_max = kwargs.get('v_max', 10)

        self.linear1 = nn.Linear(num_inputs, 32)
        self.linear2 = nn.Linear(32, 64)

        self.noisy_value1 = NoisyLinear(64, 64, use_cuda=USE_CUDA)
        self.noisy_value2 = NoisyLinear(64, self.num_atoms, use_cuda=USE_CUDA)

        self.noisy_advantage1 = NoisyLinear(64, 64, use_cuda=USE_CUDA)
        self.noisy_advantage2 = NoisyLinear(64, self.num_atoms * self.num_actions,
                                            use_cuda=USE_CUDA)


[docs]    def forward(self, x):
        batch_size = x.size(0)

        x = F.relu(self.linear1(x))
        x = F.relu(self.linear2(x))

        value = F.relu(self.noisy_value1(x))
        value = self.noisy_value2(value)

        advantage = F.relu(self.noisy_advantage1(x))
        advantage = self.noisy_advantage2(advantage)

        value = value.view(batch_size, 1, self.num_atoms)
        advantage = advantage.view(batch_size, self.num_actions, self.num_atoms)

        x = value + advantage - advantage.mean(1, keepdim=True)
        x = F.softmax(x.view(-1, self.num_atoms)).view(-1, self.num_actions, self.num_atoms)

        return x



[docs]    def reset_noise(self):
        self.noisy_value1.reset_noise()
        self.noisy_value2.reset_noise()
        self.noisy_advantage1.reset_noise()
        self.noisy_advantage2.reset_noise()



[docs]    def act(self, state):
        state = Variable(torch.FloatTensor(state).unsqueeze(0), volatile=True)
        dist = self.forward(state).data.cpu()
        dist = dist * torch.linspace(self.v_min, self.v_max, self.num_atoms)
        action = dist.sum(2).max(1)[1].numpy()[0]
        return action




[docs]class ReinforceNetwork(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, num_inputs, action_space, hidden_size=256):
        super(ReinforceNetwork, self).__init__()
        self.action_space = action_space
        num_outputs = action_space

        self.linear1 = nn.Linear(num_inputs, hidden_size)
        self.linear2 = nn.Linear(hidden_size, num_outputs)


[docs]    def forward(self, inputs):
        x = inputs
        x = F.relu(self.linear1(x))
        logits = self.linear2(x)
        return logits



[docs]    def full_pass(self, state):
        logits = self.forward(state)
        dist = torch.distributions.Categorical(logits=logits)
        action = dist.sample()
        logpa = dist.log_prob(action).unsqueeze(-1)
        entropy = dist.entropy().unsqueeze(-1)
        is_exploratory = action != np.argmax(logits.detach().cpu().numpy())
        return action.item(), is_exploratory.item(), logpa, entropy



[docs]    def select_action(self, state):
        logits = self.forward(state)
        dist = torch.distributions.Categorical(logits=logits)
        action = dist.sample()
        return action.item()



[docs]    def select_greedy_action(self, state):
        logits = self.forward(state)
        return np.argmax(logits.detach().numpy())




[docs]class ReinforceBaselineNetwork(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, num_inputs, action_space):
        super(ReinforceBaselineNetwork, self).__init__()
        self.fc_shared = nn.Linear(num_inputs, 128)
        self.fc_policy = nn.Linear(128, action_space)
        self.fc_value_function = nn.Linear(128, 1)


[docs]    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(self.fc_shared(x))
        value = self.fc_value_function(x)
        logits = self.fc_policy(x)
        return logits, value



[docs]    def full_pass(self, state):
        logits, value = self.forward(state)
        dist = torch.distributions.Categorical(logits=logits)
        action = dist.sample()
        logpa = dist.log_prob(action).unsqueeze(-1)
        entropy = dist.entropy().unsqueeze(-1)
        action = action.item()
        is_exploratory = action != np.argmax(logits.detach().cpu().numpy(), axis=-1)
        return action, is_exploratory, logpa, entropy, value



[docs]    def select_action(self, state):
        logits, _ = self.forward(state)
        dist = torch.distributions.Categorical(logits=logits)
        action = dist.sample()
        action = action.item()
        return action



[docs]    def select_greedy_action(self, state):
        logits, _ = self.forward(state)
        return np.argmax(logits.detach().numpy())



[docs]    def evaluate_state(self, state):
        _, value = self.forward(state)
        return value




[docs]class ActorCriticNetwork(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, num_inputs, num_outputs, hidden_size=128, std=0.0):
        super(ActorCriticNetwork, self).__init__()

        self.critic = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(num_inputs, hidden_size),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(hidden_size, 1)
        )

        self.actor = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(num_inputs, hidden_size),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(hidden_size, num_outputs),
            # nn.Softmax(),
        )


[docs]    def forward(self, x):
        value = self.critic(x)
        logits = self.actor(x)
        # dist = Categorical(probs)
        return logits, value



[docs]    def full_pass(self, state):
        logits, value = self.forward(state)
        dist = torch.distributions.Categorical(logits=logits)
        # dist = torch.distributions.Categorical(probs=logits)
        action = dist.sample()
        # print(action)
        logpa = dist.log_prob(action).unsqueeze(-1)
        entropy = dist.entropy().unsqueeze(-1)
        action = action.item()
        is_exploratory = action != np.argmax(logits.detach().cpu().numpy(), axis=-1)
        return action, is_exploratory, logpa, entropy, value



[docs]    def select_action(self, state):
        logits, _ = self.forward(state)
        action = np.random.choice(self.action_size, p=logits.cpu().numpy())
        # dist = torch.distributions.Categorical(logits=logits)
        # action = dist.sample()
        # action = action.item() if len(action) == 1 else action.data.numpy()
        return action



[docs]    def select_greedy_action(self, state):
        logits, _ = self.forward(state)
        return np.argmax(logits.detach().numpy())



[docs]    def evaluate_state(self, state):
        _, value = self.forward(state)
        return value




[docs]class Actor(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, state_dim, n_actions):
        super().__init__()
        self.model = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(state_dim, 64),
            nn.Tanh(),
            nn.Linear(64, 32),
            nn.Tanh(),
            nn.Linear(32, n_actions),
            nn.Softmax()
        )


[docs]    def forward(self, X):
        return self.model(X)



# Critic module

[docs]class Critic(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, state_dim):
        super().__init__()
        self.model = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(state_dim, 64),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(64, 32),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(32, 1)
        )


[docs]    def forward(self, X):
        return self.model(X)



if __name__ == "__main__":
    model = ReinforceNetwork(4, 2, 16)
    x = torch.rand((4, 4))
    ot = model(x)
    print(ot)
    print(x.size())
